summary:
Acquisition and Capital Raising Summary

Transaction Highlights:

  • Acquisition: Xero to acquire Melio (US SMB bill pay platform) for US$2.5B (A$3.9B) (mix of cash + scrip), with up to US$0.5B contingent payments over 3 years.
  • Valuation: ~13.4x March 2025 annualized revenue (US$187M) or ~9.7x incl. FY28 revenue synergies.
  • Revenue CAGR (FY21–25): 127%.
  • Expected synergies: US$70M revenue + US$20M cost savings by FY28.

Funding Structure:

  • A$1.85B institutional placement (fully underwritten at A$176/share, 9.4% discount to last close).
  • US$0.36B Xero scrip issued to Melio shareholders.
  • US$0.4B revolving debt facility + US$0.6B existing cash.
  • Post-transaction net debt/EBITDA: ~2.3x (pro forma FY25).

Capital Raising Timeline:

  • Placement:
  • Bookbuild: 25 Jun 2025 | Settlement: 30 Jun 2025 | Trading resumes: 26 Jun 2025.
  • SPP (Target: A$200M):
  • Record date: 24 Jun 2025 | Open: 2 Jul 2025 | Close: 21 Jul 2025.
  • Price: Lower of A$176 or 2% discount to 5-day VWAP at close.

Strategic Impact:

  • US revenue growth acceleration: Pro forma North America revenue ~3x higher post-acquisition.
  • Targets > Rule of 40 outcomes by FY28 (group level).

Conditions:

  • Expected completion within 6 months (regulatory approvals incl. HSR clearance). Break fee: US$37.5M if HSR fails.

Note: No update to FY26 guidance ex-transaction.

Extracted: Acquisition rationale, funding terms, capital raising details, and material synergies.

Trading Halt Request:
- Reason: Pending announcement regarding a corporate transaction and associated equity raising.
- Halt to remain until earlier of: (1) announcement on institutional placement completion or (2) normal trading on 26 June 2025.

(Note: Further material details on the equity raising structure, size, or pricing will be in the subsequent announcement.)
